str2: Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and lambano; to take eagerly, i.e. Seize, possess, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

word: it throws him to the ground.
parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To rend, break asunder; I break forth (into speech); I throw or dash down.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To foam (at the mouth), froth. From aphros; to froth at the mouth.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To grate, gnash (as the teeth). Apparently a primary verb; to creak, i.e. to grate the teeth.
A tooth. Perhaps from the base of esthio; a 'tooth'.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To dry up, parch, be ripened, wither, waste away. From xeros; to desiccate; by implication, to shrivel, to mature.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To have strength, be strong, be in full health and vigor, be able; meton: I prevail. From ischus; to have force.
